question: Which Design Decision Category fits requirements addressing... "Named technologies, changes to technologies (planned and unplanned)."
Which Design Decision Category fits requirements addressing... "Names of external elements, protocols, sensors or actuators (devices), middleware, network configurations."
Which Design Decision Category fits requirements addressing... "Plans for teaming, processors, families of processors, evolution of processors, network configuration."
Which Design Decision Category fits requirements addressing... "Processing steps, information flows, major domain entities, access rights, persistence, evolution requirements"
Which Design Decision Category fits requirements addressing... "Extension of or flexibility of functionality, regional distinctions, language distinctions, portability, calibrations, configurations."
What is QAW an abbreviation for?
What is the main goal of the Quality Attribute Workshop (QAW)?
options: Design, assess, and evaluate quality attribute scenarios
Generate, prioritize and refine quality attribute scenarios
Present quality attributes to software architects
